text: Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Morrigan the Phantom Queen arrives to lead your armies!
The Phantom Queen
Dural Durak arrives to lead your armies!
Lord Of The Truthsayers
As long as they aren't too injured or weakened, the charge of this unit will be savage, uncompromising and simply devastating.
Centaurs are fast and deadly in melee.
Fenbeasts are durable magic undead constructs, able to cause and endure a lot of damage.
Bordweall
An ancient but effective tactic, warriors stand shoulder to shoulder, holding their shields against their neighbours, creating a formidable wall of shields.
Something to Prove

Warleaders are the strongest and fiercest warriors of Albion. They usually have command over the warbands of several tribes and clans and will be called upon whenever the people of Albion have to wage war on a larger scale.
A Chieftan is a mighty warrior who gained leadership of a whole clan or tribe. In war, they serve as officers of a Warleader. New Warleaders usually emerge from the ranks of the mightiest Chieftains.

No one knows the exact origin of the mysterious woman called Morrigan. Most inhabitants of Albion believe that she is a goddess of death and war who will sometimes aid her people when they are in great danger.

Wyrd Druids have walked the Path of the Truthsayers, but either failed or left this path on their own. Despite only being able to cast simpler spells, they are still highly valued and often employed by chieftains as their personal advisors.

No one knows the exact origin of the mysterious woman called Morrigan. Most inhabitants of Albion believe that she is a goddess of death and war who will sometimes aid her people when they are in great danger.
Mightiest and wisest of the Truthsayers, Dural Durak leads Albion's ranks in times of peace and war.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Chariot
The chariots built in Albion might look crude to more civilized folk, but they are well constructed and surprisingly dangerous on the field.
